title: Matchstick Pattern
core_prompt: Sticks follow 3, 5, 7, ... for 1, 2, 3 triangles. How many sticks for 8 triangles?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: Write a rule for n triangles.

solution_steps: First term is 3 and difference is 2.

title: Handshakes Lite
core_prompt: How many unique pairs can be made from 6 students?
hint_ladder: Now do the same pattern for 6 students.
You are counting pairs, not people.

title: Truth Tokens
core_prompt: Boxes are labeled Apples, Oranges, Mixed. Every label is wrong. One draw allowed. What do you draw from first?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.answer: Because every label is wrong and one true identity locks others.

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: How might this change with 4 boxes?

hint_ladder: Use the rule: all labels are wrong.
Pick the box with most info.
The Mixed label cannot be mixed.
Reveal: draw from the Mixed-labeled box.
solution_steps: The Mixed-labeled box must be pure apples or pure oranges.
That one draw fixes that box and forces the other two labels.

title: Rectangle Cut
core_prompt: Can a 6x6 square be cut and rearranged into a 9x4 rectangle (no stretching)?

extensions.label: Extension 1
extensions.prompt: What must stay the same when rearranging?

title: Take 1 or 2
core_prompt: 15 stones. You can take 1 or 2 each turn. Last stone wins. Best first move?
hint_ladder: Reveal: multiples of 3 are losing positions.
solution_steps: Take 1 first and then mirror to keep each pair of moves totaling 3.

title: Grid Paths
core_prompt: How many shortest paths on a 3x3 grid if you only move right or up?
solution_steps: You need 3 rights and 3 ups (6 total moves).

title: Always/Sometimes/Never
core_prompt: For integer n, is n^2 - n always even?
hint_ladder: Consecutive integers include an even number.
Reveal: product has a factor of 2.
solution_steps: One of n and n-1 is even, so the product is even.

title: Mystery Weights
core_prompt: 2s + m = 19 and s + 2m = 17. Find s - m.

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: If totals are 31 and 29, what changes?

hint_ladder: Subtract one equation from the other.
Do the same on the right side.

title: Folded Corners
core_prompt: Square side 8. Fold one corner to the center. Find crease length.
hint_ladder: Find midpoint from corner to center.
solution_steps: Using the perpendicular bisector gives crease length 4*sqrt(2).

title: Digit Sums
core_prompt: How many 2-digit numbers have digits that sum to 10?
solution_steps: Each gives one valid ones digit, so 9 total.

title: Switch Lamps
core_prompt: 3 switches control 3 lamps upstairs. You can go upstairs once. How do you match them?

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: How could you encode info for 4 lamps?

hint_ladder: Use one switch long, one short, one off.
solution_steps: Turn A on for a while then off, turn B on, leave C off.
Upstairs: lit = B, warm dark = A, cold dark = C.

title: Consecutive Cubes
core_prompt: If n is even, is (n+1)^3 - n^3 always odd?

extensions.label: Extension 2
extensions.prompt: Parity of consecutive cube differences in general?

hint_ladder: Reveal: 3n(n+1) is even, then +1 is odd.
solution_steps: n(n+1) is even, so even + 1 is odd.
